This issue is too important to WI farmers, ranchers, loggers & sportsmen for me to support this legislation in the absence of a solution. I'll continue to fight for gray wolf listing decisions to be made by wildlife experts now that its population is a threat to livestock & pets.

A bipartisan amendment I introduced would’ve ensured that wolf management plans based on federal and state wildlife expertise could move forward without legal ambiguity, but the amendment was not included.

While the Natural Resources Management Act included a number of good provisions, it did not address a critical issue for Wisconsin: delisting the gray wolf as an endangered species in the western Great Lakes region.
